summary: This bill, the "No Tax on Tips Act," aims to amend the Internal Revenue Code to eliminate income tax on qualified tips. It allows individual taxpayers to deduct qualified tips, up to $25,000, from their taxable income. The bill also directs the Secretary of the Treasury to publish a list of occupations traditionally receiving tips. Additionally, it extends the employer social security tax credit related to employee tips to include beauty service establishments and makes other related changes.
